definition: lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly

sentences.english: Race against time, never give up, believe in yourself, will win everything.
sentences.chinese: 爭分奪秒，永不言棄，相信自己，將贏得一切勝利。

sentences.english: B:But you have been fighting against the clock in your work, and they can't understand you, either.
sentences.chinese: 但你卻爲了工作在爭分奪秒，他們對此也感到不解。

sentences.english: For example, sitting down and creating a novel is intimidating.
sentences.chinese: 舉個例子來說，創作小說是十分爭分奪秒的一件事。

sentences.english: Mr. Teweidi speeds up fixing a machine here, Jin Jie they also make every minute and second count .
sentences.chinese: 特維迪先生這邊加緊修理機器，金婕他們也爭分奪秒。

sentences.english: Barack Obama’s new economic team wasted no time starting out on this course.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬新的經濟團隊爭分奪秒地按照這個途徑推進。

definition: one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to make way (for sth)
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to work to no avail (idiom)
fair competition
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
surefire; absolutely safe (idiom)
to reboot/to restart
doctors and nurses/medic/medical (personnel)
disproof/rebuttal/reductio ad absurdum
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
